item.title: 大型汽车制造商希望国会禁止加州 2035 年电动汽车计划
item.description: 主要汽车制造商希望国会禁止加利福尼亚州到 2035 年停止销售纯汽油车的里程碑计划，该计划已被其他 11 个州采纳，他们警告说，这些规定可能会在几个月后开始影响汽车出货量。【原文：Major automakers want Congress to bar California's landmark plan to end the sale of gasoline-only vehicles by 2035 that has been adopted by 11 other states, warning the rules could begin impacting vehicle shipments in a few months.】

item.title: 罗珀技术公司因稳定的软件需求和收购而上调年度预测
item.description: 受并购和企业软件服务需求强劲的影响，罗珀科技公司（Roper Technologies）周一上调了全年营收和利润预期，第一季度业绩超出华尔街预期。【原文：Roper Technologies on Monday raised its annual forecasts for revenue and profit after beating Wall Street estimates for first-quarter results, helped by acquisitions and strong demand for its enterprise software services.】

item.title: 巴西财政部长认为南方共同市场-欧盟协议获得越来越多的支持
item.description: 巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）周一表示，随着地缘政治和贸易紧张局势的加剧，他认为南美国家集团南方共同市场与欧盟之间拖延已久的贸易协定的批准势头将有所增强。【原文：Brazilian Finance Minister Fernando Haddad said on Monday that he sees greater momentum for ratification of the long-delayed trade agreement between the South American bloc Mercosur and the European Union as geopolitical and trade tensions grow.】

item.title: 山德士首席执行官抨击欧盟范围内的药品价格提案，警告美国关税将损害患者用药权益
item.description: 仿制药生产商山德士的首席执行官说，诺华和赛诺菲的首席执行官提出的在全欧洲范围内实行新药挂牌价的建议 "漏洞百出"，无法解决全球定价不公平的问题。【原文：The chief executive of generic drugmaker Sandoz said a proposal by the CEOs of Novartis and Sanofi to introduce a Europe-wide list price for new medicines is "deeply flawed" and would not solve global pricing inequities.】

item.title: 巴西政府希望通过新的生态投资拍卖筹集 20 亿美元资金
item.description: 路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦总统的政府希望通过将于周一宣布的新拍卖会为可持续发展项目筹集 20 亿美元资金，该拍卖会是巴西生态投资计划的一部分，重点关注恢复退化牧场的举措。【原文：The government of President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva expects to raise $2 billion in financing for sustainable projects through a new auction to be announced on Monday as part of the Eco Invest Brazil program, focusing on initiatives to recover degraded pastures.】

item.title: 未来五年，IBM 将在美国投资 1500 亿美元
item.description: IBM 周一表示，计划在未来五年内在美国投资 1500 亿美元。【原文：IBM said on Monday it plans to invest $150 billion in the U.S. over the next five years.】

item.title: 消费者监督机构解除富国银行同意令，为贷款机构提供监管救济
item.description: 富国银行周一表示，消费者金融保护局（CFPB）已取消了 2018 年与富国银行合规风险管理有关的同意令，这标志着该银行在解决悬而未决的监管问题方面取得了进展。【原文：The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) has lifted a 2018 consent order related to Wells Fargo's compliance risk management, the bank said on Monday, signaling progress in resolving the lender's outstanding regulatory issues.】

item.title: BetMGM 第一季度因电子博彩激增而扭亏为盈
item.description: 美国体育博彩服务公司 BetMGM 是美高梅国际酒店集团（MGM Resorts）和 Entain 的合资企业，周一公布了第一季度的核心利润，主要得益于其 iGaming 和在线体育部门的强劲增长。【原文：U.S. sports-betting service BetMGM, a joint venture between MGM Resorts and Entain , posted core profit for the first quarter on Monday, supported by strong growth in its iGaming and online sports divisions.】

item.title: 消息人士称，巴西将提供税收减免以吸引数据中心投资
item.description: 巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）本周将开始硅谷之行，他计划通过免除相关技术投资的联邦税来吸引数据中心来巴西。【原文：Brazilian Finance Minister Fernando Haddad will begin a trip to Silicon Valley this week with a plan to lure data centers to his country by exempting the related technology investments from federal taxes, four sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 因医疗设备需求稳定，Revvity 季度业绩超出预期
item.description: Revvity 周一公布的第一季度业绩高于华尔街预期，并维持全年盈利预期，主要得益于生物技术客户对用于药物研究的医疗设备的稳定需求。【原文：Revvity reported first-quarter results above Wall Street estimates and maintained its full-year profit forecast on Monday, helped by steady demand from biotech clients for medical equipment used for drug research.】

item.title: 新华社报道：中国要求长江和记 "审慎 "处理港口交易
item.description: 据中国国家通讯社新华社周一报道，中国外交部已要求参与长江和记将其大部分港口业务出售给贝莱德领导的财团计划的各方 "谨慎行事"。【原文：China's foreign ministry has asked all parties involved in CK Hutchison's planned sale of most of its ports operations to a BlackRock-led consortium to "act prudently," state news agency Xinhua reported on Monday.】

item.title: 台湾英业达将在美国投资高达 8500 万美元以减少关税影响
item.description: 台湾合同电子制造商英业达周一表示，已同意投资高达8500万美元在德克萨斯州建设生产设施，以帮助减轻美国关税的影响。【原文：Taiwanese contract electronics manufacturer Inventec has agreed to invest up to $85 million to build manufacturing facilities in Texas to help mitigate the impact of U.S. tariffs, it said on Monday.】

item.title: 网络事件仍在继续，M&S 通知仓库代理公司员工待在家里
item.description: 英国零售商玛莎百货公司在上周发生网络事件后停止接受网上订单，周一该公司通知英格兰中部配送中心的代理公司员工待在家里。【原文：British retailer Marks & Spencer told agency staff at its central England distribution centre to stay at home on Monday, after it stopped taking online orders following a cyber incident last week.】

item.title: 美国 特朗普关税造成的损失
item.description: 美国早报【原文：Morning Bid U.S.】

item.title: 代理顾问 ISS 敦促对贝莱德的高管薪酬投反对票
item.description: 机构股东服务公司（ISS）要求贝莱德的投资者对该资产管理公司的高管薪酬计划投反对票，这是继去年贝莱德高层管理人员的薪酬计划以微弱优势胜出后，紧张局势的升级。【原文：Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) has asked BlackRock investors to vote against the asset manager's executive compensation plans, escalating tensions after a narrow win last year for its top management's remuneration packages.】

item.title: 在保加利亚与小唐纳德-特朗普举行的活动上，加密公司 Nexo 宣布重返美国市场
item.description: 加密公司 Nexo Capital 周日在保加利亚的一次会议上接待了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的长子，同时该公司表示，在支付 4500 万美元罚款以解决美国监管指控两年后，它计划重返美国市场。【原文：While hosting the eldest son of U.S. President Donald Trump at a conference in Bulgaria on Sunday, crypto company Nexo Capital said it plans to return to the American market, two years after it paid a $45 million fine to settle U.S. regulatory charges.】

item.title: 美国股指期货持平，数据和盈利考验迫在眉睫
item.description: 周一，美国股指期货变化不大，投资者正在为本周华尔街一些最大公司的关键经济数据和财报做准备，特朗普政府的贸易政策发展也是关注焦点。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were little changed on Monday as investors braced for a week packed with key economic data and earnings from some of Wall Street's biggest companies, with the Trump administration's trade policy developments also in focus.】

item.title: 墨西哥水泥制造商 Cemex 核心利润因当地市场疲软而下滑
item.description: 墨西哥水泥生产商 Cemex 周一报告称，其第一季度核心盈利下降了 18%，主要是受当地市场不利因素的影响。【原文：Mexican cement maker Cemex reported an 18% dip in its core earnings for the first quarter on Monday, driven largely by headwinds in the local market.】

item.title: 受通胀影响，多米诺比萨美国同店销售额意外下滑
item.description: 多米诺比萨（Domino's Pizza）周一公布的美国第一季度同店销售额意外下降，原因是在高通胀和宏观经济不确定的情况下，消费者减少了外出就餐的开支。【原文：Domino's Pizza on Monday posted a surprise decline in first-quarter U.S. same store sales as consumers curbed spending on dining out amid high inflation and macroeconomic uncertainty.】

item.title: 台湾和硕电子称特朗普关税可能导致美国电子产品短缺
item.description: 苹果公司和戴尔公司的重要供应商--台湾和硕电子公司（Pegatron）周一表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税令美国客户感到困惑，有可能导致美国消费电子产品短缺。【原文：Taiwan's Pegatron , an important supplier to Apple and Dell , said on Monday that President Donald Trump's tariffs were confusing U.S. customers and risked leading to shortages of consumer electronics in the United States.】

item.title: 特朗普执政 100 天后，投资者重新评估 "品牌美国 "的诱惑力
item.description: 在特朗普政府执政的头 100 天里，市场经历了一场跌宕起伏的过山车之旅，一些投资者开始远离美国资产，但美国的政策是否会导致投资者持续远离美国仍有待观察。【原文：A bruising rollercoaster ride for markets in the first 100 days of the Trump administration has seen some investors move away from American assets, but it remains to be seen whether policies have caused a sustained shift away from the United States.】

item.title: 股市的不确定性使许多美国人对旅游消费持谨慎态度
item.description: 马里兰州一家成立 5 年的旅行社的共同创始人金伯利-希利亚德（Kimberly Hilliard）说，在每年的这个时候，她通常每周会接到多达 10 个急于预订假期的客户的咨询电话，但在过去一个月的大部分时间里，她的电话都很安静。【原文：Kimberly Hilliard, co-founder of a five-year-old travel agency in Maryland, says at this time of year she usually fields up to 10 inquiries a week from clients eager to book vacations, but for much of the past month her phones have gone quiet.】

item.title: 独家报道特朗普加征关税，亚马逊部分卖家退出 Prime Day
item.description: 亚马逊的 "Prime Day "正在失去其在一个关键群体中的光彩：卖家。【原文：Amazon's Prime Day is losing its luster among a critical group: sellers.】

item.title: 马斯克为在中期选举中扮演重要捐赠者角色奠定了基础，因为他与政府选举办公室的合作即将结束
item.description: 据四位直接知情人士透露，随着亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）缩减为美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的工作，他正在为在明年的中期选举中担任共和党政治大赞助商的重要角色奠定基础。【原文：As billionaire Elon Musk scales back work for U.S. President Donald Trump, he’s laying the groundwork for a major role as a Republican political megadonor in next year’s midterm elections, according to four people with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 投资者担心原油价格下滑，大石油公司可能减少股票回购
item.description: 当埃克森美孚和雪佛龙本周公布第一季度业绩时，投资者将关注油价下跌如何增加了 2025 年剩余时间的股息和股票回购风险。【原文：When Exxon Mobil and Chevron report first-quarter results this week, investors will be focused on how falling oil prices have increased the risk to dividends and share repurchases for the rest of 2025.】

item.title: 美国航空业受到关税冲击，寻求豁免
item.description: 美国航空业因唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战和旅游需求的下滑而受到影响，正在游说白宫免除关税。【原文：The U.S. aviation industry, reeling from President Donald Trump's trade war and a slump in travel demand, is lobbying the White House for exemptions from tariffs.】

item.title: 利雅得航空公司首席执行官表示愿意购买被取消的中国订单中的波音飞机
item.description: 利雅得航空公司首席执行官托尼-道格拉斯（Tony Douglas）周一表示，如果由于中美贸易战升级而导致中国航空公司的波音飞机无法交付，这家沙特初创航空公司将准备购买这些飞机。【原文：Riyadh Air CEO Tony Douglas on Monday said that the Saudi startup carrier would be ready to buy Boeing aircraft destined for Chinese airlines if they are not delivered due to the escalating trade war between the United States and China.】

item.title: 文件显示，UnitedHealth 谋杀案发生后，美国公司增加了安全支出
item.description: 美国公司一直在增加安全支出，但在联合健康高管布莱恩-汤普森（Brian Thompson）被谋杀后，随着越来越多的公司发现高层面临的威胁加剧，2025 年的安全支出将进一步增加。【原文：U.S. corporations have been ramping up their security spending, but following the murder of UnitedHealth executive Brian Thompson that expenditure is set to rise further in 2025 as more companies see heightened threats to their top brass.】

item.title: DHL 恢复向美国消费者运送超过 800 美元的全球快件
item.description: 德国邮政旗下的 DHL 快递公司周一表示，在与美国当局进行 "建设性对话 "后，将恢复向美国个人发送价值超过 800 美元的全球企业对消费者快件。【原文：DHL Express, a division of Germany's Deutsche Post , will resume global business-to-consumer shipments worth over $800 to individuals in the United States after a "constructive dialogue" with U.S. authorities, DHL said on Monday.】

item.title: 阿提哈德航空首席执行官称未受关税动荡影响，并看到了机遇
item.description: 阿布扎比阿提哈德航空公司（Etihad Airways）首席执行官安东纳尔多-内维斯（Antonoaldo Neves）周一告诉路透社，该公司仍未受到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）关税政策近期动荡的影响。【原文：Abu Dhabi's Etihad Airways remains unaffected by recent turmoil from U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff policies, its CEO Antonoaldo Neves told Reuters on Monday, noting that it was still too early to fully gauge the effects of the levies.】
